Description: Wooden anthropoid shabti-coffin with a lappet-wig and a modelled face; the lid is inscribed with six columns of black painted Hieroglyphic text; inside are two wooden stick shabtis wrapped in linen(?) with Hieroglyphic text on both the surface and the cloth; also a separate length of a coarser textile.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
